forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. West southwest wind around 9 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.shortForecast: Patchy Fog then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog between 8am and 9am, then a chance of rain. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 8 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%.

weather_report:
As night gently whispers its farewell, the city of San Francisco rests under a blanket of clouds, their muted gray promising both coolness and intrigue. A low of around 50 degrees keeps the night air crisp, with a gentle breeze from the west southwest weaving through the streets, carrying the scent of the ocean's embrace. The dawn will greet the city with a tentative fog, a fleeting curtain that, for the briefest moments, will play hide-and-seek with the Golden Gate, teasing its silhouette and offering a glimpse of the enchanting scenery that awaits.

Saturday unfolds with the soft glow of possibility. Expect patchy fog to linger until shortly after breakfast, slowly giving way to the sun which, though reluctant, will make its presence known between the clouds. The high temperature will flirt with the mid-50s, a fitting backdrop for an afternoon where the breeze picks up, transforming the air into a spirited dance of movement and energy. Dress in layers to accommodate the shifting temperatures—perhaps a cozy sweater beneath a light jacket, perfect for a stroll along the streets or a leisurely café visit. Keep your plans spontaneous yet grounded, with a jaunt to one of the quieter parks, an exploration of the waterfront, or simply soaking in the evolving light of the cityscape. It promises to be a day where the charm of San Francisco remains palpable, a canvas painted with gentle fog and moderate winds.
